description: Originally a variant form of gay, now associated with distinct senses.

entries.meaning: (Scotland, Ireland, Northern England) Fairly good; considerable. [from 18th c.]
examples: They were married next New Year's Day, and Ellison had begun to think himself a gey man in Kinraddie, and maybe one of the gentry.
I am nae believer in auld wives' stories about ghaists, though this is gey like a place for them - But mortal, or of the other world, here they come! - twa men and a light.
